items.content:
Software Engineer – Android at Plaid

Remote

REMOTE

ENGINEERING

FULL-TIME

The product engineering team strives to make interacting with financial data not only better, but delightful. We believe that the key to solving finance’s biggest problems lies in meeting modern user expectations. As the gateway for thousands of applications like Coinbase, Qapital, or Truebill, Plaid’s platform calls for innovative problem solvers interested in tackling the complex challenges that exist in the financial ecosystem and scaling developer and user-facing systems to millions of users.

To develop top-tier, heavy-UI applications like Plaid Link, we are looking for people who excel across the disciplines of mobile engineering. This means a deep understanding of the native platforms, full-stack systems, scalability and performance, the nature of the HTTP protocol, and the varied edge cases in mobile devices.

What excites you

  • Working on an Android SDK using Java
  • Native SDKs that can be dropped into third-party applications
  • The possibility to work remotely
  • Working with engineers with an eye for design and designers who code
  • Products with real impact: Your work will touch tens of millions of end users, the best applications in fintech, and major U.S. financial institutions
  • Digging through finance’s complex challenges—and reimagining the experience completely
  • You’re a remote engineer looking to join a company with an amazing remote team and remote culture owning one of the most impactful teams at Plaid

What excites us

  • A minimum of 3 years of experience building Android applications in industry experience
  • Profound understanding of (and passion for) Android with an enthusiasm for building components and systems with reliability and long term support in mind
  • UI instincts, but not necessarily the ability to create comps from scratch
  • iOS knowledge is a big plus
  • A background in startups is a plus
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in Computer Science, Engineering, or a closely related field
Apply for job

items.content:
This is a 100% Remote role.

Our client's app is reaching millions and is at the top of the iOS and Play Store. Their purpose is to help people feel close and they strive to create an environment where their people are inspired to do their best work. They work in a distributed, remote small team and strive for a positive, enjoyable environment where everyone enjoys coming (remotely) work. This is a 100% remote position with occasional travel to spend time with your teammates and to plan for the business.

We're looking for a thoughtful and creative Senior Mobile Engineer to join our team. You are someone who feels pride from writing solid code. You enjoy creating new user experiences and solving fun technical problems. You delight in making a difference for millions of people in the world and you care about having a joyful work environment.

Technical Skills:

  • 4+ years of IOS experience. Deep experience in the IOS Stack - Swift / Objective-C.
  • Team Lead / Architect experience is a big plus.
  • Experience with C / C++ would give you a head start on our code base.
  • Experience with lower level challenges. Enjoys technical challenges and building without using frameworks

You will:

  • Collaborate with teammates to implement and launch highly visible, user-facing features from start to finish
  • Produce solid quality code, raising the bar for the whole team on quality and speed
  • Work with one or more of Swift, ObjectiveC, Java, Kotlin, C++ and/or Python

You may be a fit if you:

  • Communicate with empathy
  • Would excel in a small, lean startup environment.
  • Understand the business and how your technical contributions contribute to the bigger picture.
  • Have founded your own company before
  • Remain calm and even-keeled, especially in a storm
  • Have effective interpersonal, communication, and collaboration skills to work successfully in a 100% remote team environment
  • Enjoy reverse engineering from inputs and outputs of black-box systems
  • Pride yourself on strong foundation in computer science, data structures, algorithms and software design
  • Are humble and intellectually curious

This is a permanent position for a California based client.

We can not sponsor or consider C2C for this role

- provided by Dice

items.content:
*Please note that this is a remote position, open to applicants within 2 hours of GMT/UTC TimeZone.*

*Please only apply is you are in time Zones, GMT-1, GMT, GMT+1*

A remote position is available for a Senior Android Developer to join a Berlin based company on a 6 month contract basis, with the opportunity to extend. This position is open to remote candidates within the United Kingdom (UK), or the European Union within 1 hour of GMT. Developers must have prior expertise in Android development.

You'll be working as part of a team of talented mobile developers, on an Automotive project for a well known end client with a large userbase. You'll bring your expertise to the table and contribute ideas and solutions based on your extensive Android Development experience from working on Large Scale projects for well known companies.

Requirements

  • Minimum four (4) years of hands-on experience in a technical position with the implementation and utilization of Android application development
  • Extensive Prior experience in design and development of Android applications for recognisable brands.
  • Ability to convert functional requirements into user interface designs and prototypes, and developed application(s)
  • Must possess strong communication skills with the ability to work well both solo and in a project team environment
  • Excellent client facing experience eg, product demos, requirements gathering, definition of technology needs and application design
  • Enthusiasm for technology with eyes on current trends and technologies in the area of mobile application development
  • Dedication to continued learning and growth within mobile application technologies
  • Experience with multiple IDEs (eg Eclipse, Android Studio, IntelliJ IDEA, NetBeans)
  • Commercial experience with Kotlin
  • Demonstratable apps on the PlayStore, preferably large scale projects in the Automotive Industry.
  • Experience with Fabric/Crashlytics or similar
  • Firebase experience or similar

What's on offer?

  • 6 Month Contract (extension likely)
  • Quick Start (ideally 3 weeks or less)
  • €60 per hour, negotiable
  • Remote working
  • Wellknown end client
  • Large Scale Project

To be considered, please apply online or reach out to Peter Grint for further information.

Applicants for this role must be located in the EU or UK - this role is for a Freelance Developer only - Development Houses/COnsultancies need not apply.

items.content:
Mobile Engineer at Bodybuilding.com

Remote

Engineering

Boise, Idaho

Pre-approved location, United States

Bodybuilding.com is the world’s largest online sports nutrition retailer, offering its visitors over 12,000 products, over 25,000 articles, 9,000 plus videos and a robust social network with over 1.5 million members all designed to help our visitors achieve their health, fitness and appearance goals! Employees have ranked us as one of Idaho’s Best Places to Work for 4 straight years!

Core Values:

CUSTOMER

F – Fearless & Fast We are not afraid to fail! We embrace risk and drive change with urgency.

I – Inclusive We honor, respect and encourage diversity and differences! We celebrate wins by collaborating, sharing goals, supporting each other and having fun.

R – Results Driven We are passionate about customers and business results! We achieve results through talent nurturing, intentional goal setting, data-driven decisions and execution.

S – Serve Communities We give back to the communities to which we owe our success! Our customers, colleagues, partners, family, friends and neighbors.

T – Trust & Accountability We empower and hold each other accountable to deliver on commitments, and trust each other’s positive intent.

Our Mission:

To help people change their life and become their best self!

Job Summary:
We are seeking experienced mobile developers who want to use their expertise in architecture and designing mobile application experience to help define the direction of applications that literally change lives. Candidates should have experience in building native applications in JavaScript, Java, Objective-C, and Swift using 3rd-party libraries and at least one app in either the Apple or Google app store.

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Working with the product owner to develop requirements for new features
  • Finding and fixing bugs
  • Researching new techniques and libraries
  • Testing code
  • Collaborating with others

We give a lot of freedom to developers in decision-making and input, so candidate should demonstrate familiarity and expertise in all things mobile.

Knowledge, Education, Skills, and Abilities:

  • 3+ years developing mobile applications, React Native a big plus.
  • Apps in the Google Play Store or Apple App Store
  • Familiarity with Material Design and Apple Human Interface Guidelines
  • Solid knowledge of architectural approaches (MVC, MVP, MVVM)
  • Building apps against REST based APIs
  • Embedded databases experience
  • Automation testing, continuous integration and unit testing
  • Experience deploying software to large user bases a plus

Bodybuilding.com offers its employees several benefits such as: health, dental and vision insurance; 401(k); Competitive bonuses; Gym Membership Reimbursement; Employee Discount

Bodybuilding.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this classification. It is not designed to contain or to be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of the employee assigned to this job.

Remote iOS Tech Lead | £70,000 | Surrey

Swift/UIKit/CoreData/Objective C

Job Summary

My client is an exciting tech firm that builds high performance mobile applications for a number of international clients, spanning over 70 countries. Due to growth, they are looking to bring on a talented iOS Tech Lead to join their exisiting team.

This role is open for a talented iOS Developer to work on a fully remote basis, albeit you would be required on site in Surrey for the occasional team or client meeting.

The main responsibility for the role will be to ensure the smooth delivery of iOS projects for external clients, starting from working with stakeholders and requirement taking, to the delivery of the final project. The Tech Lead will be responsible for overseeing projects and working to help other members of the team with technical guidance.

This role provides the opportunity to work on projects for a number of renowned brands with a highly talented team. My client looks to provide a great team culture and benefits packages, which includes flexible working hours and the option for unlimited holiday.

Key Skills

- Experience with coding in Swift for iOS

- Knowledge of iOS Frameworks such as UIKit, CoreDate, Corelocation etc

- Experience of working with third party librairies and API

- Some knowledge RxSwift

- Some knowledge of Objective C

- Working experience of CI/CD

Further Information

If you'd like further information about the role, please get in touch with Tom Farrington at Premier IT.

Be aware that the Tech Lead would be required to be based in the UK and there is no visa sponsorship available.

items.content:
iOS Developer Experience Engineer, SDKs

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Mobile Developer
Industry: Information Technology, IT Security, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 201–500 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Auth0 | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-02:00) Sao Paulo +/- 2 hours

Technologies

ios
objective-c
swift
react-native
javascript
Culture
vision and principles
Nathan Totten Director of Customer Success at Auth0 8.9k 1 29 38
twistedstream 110 1 7
KukicAdo 3 2
eduardods 56 3

Job description

Auth0’s mission is to help developers innovate faster. Every company is becoming a software company and developers are at the center of this shift. They need better tools and building blocks so they can stay focused on innovating. One of these building blocks is identity: authentication and authorization. That’s what we do. Our platform handles 2.5B logins per month for thousands of customers around the world. From indie makers to Fortune 500 companies, we can handle any use case. We like to think that we are helping make the internet safer.We have raised $210M to date and are growing quickly. Our team is spread across more than 35 countries and we are proud to continually be recognized as a great place to work.  Culture is critical to us, and we are transparent about our  vision and principles.Join us on this journey to make developers more productive while making the internet safer!Auth0 is looking for an experienced iOS engineer across the following technologies:- iOS (Swift)- React Native (Familiarity with native build tools, Xcode & Android Studio)- JavascriptYou GET developers! You know what they need, how to talk to them, how to make their lives easier, what makes them click, their dissatisfiers and their delighters. You recognize when a framework, library or product provides a great experience. As an iOS Engineer, you will use those superpowers to improve our entire onboarding process, SDKs, Quickstarts, Docs, and provide direct assistance to developers in our support channels. You will be the internal and external steward of the experience for the technologies that you love working with every day.Each Engineer shepherds one or multiple platforms forward, both internally within Auth0, and externally in the community.You will be working in a cross-functional team alongside the developer evangelist, onboarding, growth, dashboard, community, and SDK teams to provide the best developer experience for the technologies you own.The most important qualifications for this position are software engineering expertise, empathy, and self-direction.

You will be

    • Writing, curating, editing developer resources: tutorials, examples, guides, and documentation.
    • Directly shaping and developing our open source SDKs.
    • Owning the code samples and implementation guidance for Auth0.
    • Championing Auth0 by engaging directly with the community.
    • Gathering and channel user feedback within the company to improve the experience for developers on Auth0.
    • The go-to-expert in the company, internally and externally, providing domain knowledge and reviews for Auth0 in these technologies.
    • Sharing your technical expertise at conferences and other tech events.
    • Developing our iOS Libraries that allow users to integrate seamlessly with Auth0.
    • Working on our Quickstarts guides to delight our developers.
    • Troubleshooting and fixing issues with our libraries.

You'd be a great fit if you ❤️

    • Have developed iOS Libraries or SDKs to be consumed by other developers.
    • Have a good understanding of the iOS Frameworks.
    • Have created iOS applications that have seen the light of day.
    • Have Hybrid library development experience.
    • You are able to work in a team environment, have good communication skills and understand the value of collaboration.
    • A deep understanding of writing, running, maintaining and debugging applications.
    • The ability to communicate effectively in person and in writing as a presenter, documenter.
    • Excellent written and verbal communication skills: presenting, documenting, troubleshooting.
    • Demonstrable experience authoring developer documentation (tutorials, blog posts, docs).
    • The ability to be self-directed and be effective working independently, yet feel equally comfortable contributing in a global team environment.

Bonus points if you have

    • Experience working in distributed teams and work environments.
    • Created open-source material or have contributed to open-source projects.
    • Your own technical blog or published articles on popular iOS sites.
    • Knowledge in the identity and access management space.

Preferred Locations:

    • (GMT-4); (GMT-3); (GMT-2); (GMT-1); (GMT); (GMT+1)
Auth0 is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Auth0 conducts all employment-related activities without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, genetics, or status as a Vietnam-era special disabled and other covered veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Apply now

About Auth0

Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Its extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 1.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. Auth0 has raised more than $110 million to date and continues its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture, and are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We are transparent about how we run our recruiting process - you can read all about it here. You can also read about our company culture here.

Benefits

  • Flexible Work Arrangements
  • Competitive Equity
  • Top-of-the-Line Macbooks and other great tools
  • Embrace Distributed Work
  • Inclusive Work Environment
  • Annual all-expenses paid international company offsite

items.title: Android Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=4, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Product

Taz is a completely new communications channel that will change the way you communicate with the people that matter to you most. It’s based on authenticity, exchange and communicating a glimpse of what your reality is Right Now, with absolutely no lurking.

State of the Union

We’ve just launched our apps on the App and Play Stores, so we’re at a very exciting time, and looking for someone to join the team to take control of the Android platform as we iterate and move forward.

Check it out on the Play Store!

We have closed our first funding round which was lead by Michael Birch (Ex-Founder of Bebo) and a raft of very prominent angels in London including the Ex-CTO of Mind Candy.

Team and Values

Taz is being led by Tariq Aris and George Green, both experienced founders, who have scaled and exited multiple consumer-facing startups in the past.

We’re still forming our core team, and part of that is a distributed development team. We strongly believe this is the best way to build a dev team in the digital age as it gives us access to a global pool of incredible talent (and we want the best) rather than arbitrarily limiting ourselves to people who live near our office. Saying that we’re based in Old Street in London, where you’d be more than welcome to come if you’re nearby, or we’ll fly you out on occasion so we can feel more team-y.

Next 12 months

You’re our ideal candidate if over the next 12 months you see yourself:

  • Taking full ownership of our existing native Android app
  • Taking an active role in the product lifecycle too, getting stuck in with everything from ideation, to platform specific UX, to implementation
  • Helping to build out and lead a world-class Android development team as we move forward in our journey
  • Helping to define and develop best practices and internal processes to help the team grow and run smoothly
  • Ending every day a better developer than you were at the start, we’re big on personal growth!

So… If you’re up for a fresh new challenge at the very first steps of our journey, get in touch ASAP!
